conclusion: To determine which container (E or F) the liquid will flow into after passing through the baffles, we need to analyze the paths created by the baffles.
The baffles are colored and positioned in a way that they direct the flow of liquid.
The colors and positions of the baffles are as follows: A: Red, B: Green, C: Gray, D: Black.
The red baffle directs the flow downward and to the right from A.
The liquid will flow past the red baffle and continue downward from A.
The liquid from A will then encounter the black baffle, which directs it further to the right.
The liquid from A will flow into container F.
The green baffle directs the flow downward and to the left from B.
The liquid will flow past the green baffle and continue downward from B.
The liquid from B will then encounter the white baffle, which directs it further to the left.
The liquid from B will flow into container E.
The gray baffle directs the flow downward and to the right from C.
The liquid will flow past the gray baffle and continue downward from C.
The liquid from C will then encounter the black baffle, which directs it further to the right.
The liquid from C will flow into container F.
The black baffle directs the flow downward and to the right from D.
The liquid will flow past the black baffle and continue downward from D.
The liquid from D will then encounter the white baffle, which directs it further to the left.
The liquid from D will flow into container E.
Liquids from inlets A and C will flow into container F.
Liquids from inlets B and D will flow into container E.
Final Answer: Liquid from A and C will flow into container F. Liquid from B and D will flow into container E.
